attributes.action: Reassess general aviation airfields as green belt not brown field sites.
attributes.background: Airfields around the country are categorised  as brown field sites making them attractive for development of housing estates. However these airfields are 90% grass land. Reassessing them as green belt will protect our green countryside, protect local employment and protect general aviation.
attributes.additional_details: General Aviation airfields are home to wild flowers, plants and grasses as well as many small animals and birds. Our future commercial pilots start their training at these airfields which provide local employment. We will miss this national resource when it's too late and they have been dug up for housing. These are green sites and must be afforded the same protection as farm land.

attributes.action:
Block or change the EASA Commission Regulation
on Unmanned Aircraft Operations
attributes.background:
The UK UAV industry is currently thriving
and is even recognised by EASA themselves “Unmanned aircraft is a sector of aviation that is developing very fast and has a great potential for producing new jobs and growth.“

 BUT With the EASA new proposed regulations all of this is under threat.
attributes.additional_details:
“Drones” and other UAV are well covered under the Civil Aviation Authority Air Navigation Order. Regarded by most as fair and accurate

EASA proposals will override this (even once we have left the EU)
And have clearly been written by people with little understand of the subject. the expected result of them is:

* Death of the related industry (not a slowdown but an outright death)

* Public disregard for all rules

*cease of UAV use for UK emergency services and other lifesaving uses

attributes.action: Make 'Nutritionist' a legally protected title
attributes.background: Currently, due to lack of regulation, anyone can set up and practice as a nutritionist/nutritional therapist, meaning there is no real protection for consumers. The Government should take action to prevent unqualified people from potentially putting people’s health at risk.
attributes.additional_details: There is very little understanding about what a ‘Registered Nutritionist’ is and how it compares to a nutritional therapist, nutritionist, nutrition advisor (the list of terms goes on). Yes, we have a UK voluntary register of Nutritionists held by the Association for Nutrition but this goes (mostly) unnoticed by the media and the public. It’s vital that we increase the awareness of this register so that people understand where to go to for accurate, evidence based advice.

attributes.action: Exempt Non-EU NHS professionals from £35,000 salary threshold
attributes.background: Since April 2016, Non-EU citizens wishing to remain permanently in the UK have been required to earn £35,000 a year on a single contracted salary. I find this rule discriminates unfairly against those who chose to work in the NHS, where such a salary is impossible within first 5 years of employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Like many others I came to the UK to complete my MSc and now wish to remain working for NHS making differences to people's lives on a daily basis. I have been living here for over 7 years and working extra hours during nights/weekends to meet the threshold however it is not good enough to secure my place here unless something changes.
Sadly there are many others facing the same hardship and I believe that the threshold should be lowered to at least the average UK salary £28,000 for NHS staff.

attributes.action: Amend existing Hate Crime legislation to specifically include disabled people.
attributes.background:
Hate crimes are recorded for disabled people, however the criminal offences detailing hate crime, do not cover disabled people.
Crime & Disorder Act 1998 "Hostility on the grounds of race & religion"
Public Order Act 1986 "Stirring up hatred on the grounds of race, religion & sexual orientation"
attributes.additional_details:
Legislation needs to be clear and precise in its definition of the people targeted by hate crime and in the sentencing of those who commit hate crimes. It is a unique offence and needs to protect all those whose lives are devastated or ended through hatred. 
Disabled people cannot choose not to be disabled. 
Disabled people need the law to be amended to offer them full protection and to serve as a deterrent in sentencing those, motivated by hatred & hostility, who commit targeted offences.

attributes.action: NHS pensions for ALL Dental Care Professionals who work in NHS Dental Practices.
attributes.background: Dental Care Professionals working in General Dental Practices with an NHS contract, providing NHS care are not entitled to an NHS pension and the full benefits of providing NHS care to patients. Working under or alongside NHS Dental practice owners or associate dentists who are entitled to this.
attributes.additional_details: All members of the Dental Team whether that be a Dental Nurse working along side an NHS dentist, Dental Therapists and Hygienists who work under a Dentist or associates prescription, or the Practice Managers and reception/admin staff ALL contribute to an NHS contract and the NHS care provided to patients.

attributes.action: Order a public enquiry into the PCSE Contract, and its impact on NHS services.
attributes.background: The Primary Care Support England contract was awarded to Capita by NHS England and commenced in March 2016. The service has lost countless medical records, placed services in jeopardy, and resulted in delays to junior doctors being able to start in their posts.

attributes.action: Call on Government to commission an independent technical review of HS2
attributes.background:
HS2 cannot meet its stated objective of delivering “..hugely enhanced capacity and connectivity between our major conurbations”. 

We call on HM Government to commission an independent technical review of every aspect of the HS2 scheme to determine how and why this failure has happened.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 is an ill-conceived and fundamentally flawed design for a high speed rail line linking London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Originally costed at £30 billion, it is now estimated to cost £56 billion or more. The project is highly controversial because of HS2 Ltd’s failure to evaluate cheaper & better alternatives, its exorbitant cost, insufficient new capacity, poor connectivity, demolition of 500+ homes, serious damage to the Chilterns AONB & Ancient Woodlands and failure to reduce CO2

attributes.action: Protect the A&E and Women & Children's Unit at Telford's Princess Royal Hospital
attributes.background:
Future Fit ('FF') was tasked with improving care in the Telford and Shrewsbury Hospitals.

FF's proposals include closing one of the two current A&E units and possibly moving Women and Children's ('WC') services, despite investment in a dedicated £28 million facility in Telford just two years ago.
attributes.additional_details:
Both Telford and Shropshire have growing populations and accommodate different geographical locations; both current A&E units struggle - local healthcare needs expanding not retracting. Reducing to one A&E will cause unnecessary strain, and ultimately, deaths.

In 2014 the Health Secretary promised that “we commit to A&E on both sites and there are no plans to change that”. Mr Hunt is called upon to ensure that commitment is kept.

Moving WC services would be a waste of a £28 million investment.

attributes.action: Give votes urgently to the 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum
attributes.background: The political scene is fragile and unstable because of the Government’s small majority with most MPs opposed to Brexit.  Urgently enfranchise the some 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum (46½ million electors) so that future elections and referendums are more properly representative
attributes.additional_details:
The 5½ million are
a) 1.5 million 16- and 17-year olds in the UK (as could vote in the Scottish referendum)
b) 2.0 million British Citizens living abroad disqualified by the 15-year rule or because never on a UK electoral roll (as in the Conservatives’ as-yet unkept “Votes for Life” manifesto promise)
c) 2.2 million unenfranchised foreigners living permanently in the UK (as would be electors if in New Zealand)

Numbers are derived from 2014-15 ONS and UN data. For details visit bit.ly/2cn7hrO

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the Prison System
attributes.background:
Our Prison System is in crisis - experts accurately describe it as in 'meltdown'. 
A plethora of independent HMI Prison inspection reports has consistently supported this view. 
Yesterday prison officers raised anguished voices, outside our prisons in guttural cries of despair. 
Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details: Our Prison System has no direction, funding, or vision for delivery. Prison staff are daily facing drugs, drones, suicides, self-harm, murders, escapes from closed conditions, and vicious physical assaults from drug-induced prisoners now running at 65 assaults a day, every day. Enough is enough. Independent HMI Prison inspection  reports deliver evidence weekly of decay and collapse. We need an independent inquiry into the future of the Prison  Service, it's mission, conditions and resources.

attributes.action: As soon as the UK exits the EU legislate to end the export of live farm animals.
attributes.background:
The transport of live animals exported from the UK causes immense suffering. This trade is governed by EU law, not the UK government.

The government should plan legislation to ban the export of live farm animals in favour of a carcass only trade and introduce this as soon as we leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Long distance travel causes enormous suffering: overcrowding; pain and stress; compromised immunity; inhumane slaughter on arrival; loss of legal safeguards. SOURCE CIWF

During live transport there is a high risk of animal suffering: handling during loading and unloading; strange sights and sounds and animals; heat stress and lack of water and rest. SOURCE RSPCA

Animals are crammed into unsuitable transport and endure gruelling journies heading for conditions illigal in this country. RSPCA

attributes.action: Develop a GCSE in Natural History.
attributes.background: Re-engagement with Britain's natural history has never been more urgent. Young people need the skills to name, observe, monitor and record wildlife. It is vital to understand the contribution nature makes to our lives  physically, culturally, emotionally and scientifically both in the past and today
attributes.additional_details:
Britain’s reputation for recording its natural history was unsurpassed anywhere in the world. Those skills are disappearing as new generations are increasingly disconnected. The UK also has outstanding nature writing, art, poetry, film and radio. It has always been integral to our culture and heritage. 
Tony Juniper: “This is a brilliant idea and I am happy to endorse, support and advocate however I can.”
Professor Tim Birkhead FRS: “This is the best idea I have heard about for a long time.”

attributes.action: Change the DLA guide to reflect the needs of children with heart conditions.
attributes.background: 12 children each day in the UK are born with heart defects, others acquire them due to viruses. Outcomes for these children have never been better with surgical advances, but they need supervision, care and medication to allow them to live longer lives.  Many also have mobility needs.
attributes.additional_details: DLA is a benefit for children with disabilities.   Decision Makers have a guide which they use to make awards.  However because heart conditions do not appear in this guide even though they were in the old 'adult' version, Decision Makers have no guidance as to what awards to give.  Because of this, often they will make no award at all.  Sometimes they make awards that don't truly reflect the needs of the child and will only make them for short periods of time when these conditions are for life.

attributes.action: Introduce Animal Health and Welfare to the school curriculum
attributes.background: Animal abuse cases have been on the rise, increasing by over 6,000 in 2014 and potentially more in 2015. Education could be a key factor to preventing the pattern from continuing into the future; reducing animal suffering and also giving future generations an understanding of animal care.
attributes.additional_details: The UK could be on the forefront of combating this through the introduction of a compulsory course that teaches students how to treat and perceive animals both wild and in our care. Education could take place both in and out of the classroom. Trips to sanctuaries, farms and zoos could be supplemented by an educational talk, allowing the students to see the animals first hand along side learning about their care and how to maintain their welfare.

attributes.action: Make British Sign Language part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: There are currently 11 million people within the United Kingdom with hearing loss. Some of these profoundly deaf - yet British Sign Language has still not been made a part of the national curriculum. I urge you all to sign this and make BSL a mandatory subject in schools.

attributes.action: Establish a commission to limit the mandate of the Bank of England and end QE.
attributes.background: Quantitative Easing (QE) attempts to create economic growth by unconventional, unproven methods. QE has been accompanied by unprecedentedly lower interest rates on savings accounts and Government bonds.These low interest rates threaten the real wealth of British savers, investors and pensioners.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May in her handling of Brexit & foreign policy
attributes.background: Theresa May is unconstitutionally going to take Britain out of the common market by a 'hard Brexit'. This threatens our economy and a impact generations to come who did not ask for it. Added to this her actions in siding with Trump & Erdogan are shaming the UK on the world stage.

attributes.action: Do Not Grant An Amnesty To allow illegal immigrants to remain after Brexit
attributes.background:
There is a petition active calling for an amnesty which will allow illegal immigrants to remain in the UK after Brexit. 
This shouldn't happen. They are here illegally and should be treated as such

attributes.action: Fund Research into Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is a debilitating and often life threatening conditions, there is very little research and we are a long way off a cure, we need research.

attributes.action: Pay £350m per week to NHS or re-run EU Referendum
attributes.background: The only slogan on the side of the Leave EU campaign bus stated in large letters that if we left the EU, £350m per week could go to the NHS. The government has now stated that this will not happen so the reason thousands voted for Brexit and the democratic will of the people has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details: The UK electorate was also led to believe that continued access to the EU single market would be likely if we voted to leave the EU. Many people believed this but the government has stated it will not be seeking to remain in the single market. There is clear evidence of dissatisfaction with the presentation of information from both sides prior to the referendum and subsequently numerous leave voters have expressed regret that they believed the misinformation upon which they based their decision.

attributes.action: Ensure a new hospital is built central to all West Hertfordshire communities
attributes.background:
It must be purpose-built and equipped to modern standards with enough space for parking and future expansion.

We are members of the New Hospital Campaign formed to request a new hospital on a central, accessible site between the three main towns - Hemel Hempstead, St. Albans and Watford.
attributes.additional_details:
The local NHS is proposing to keep the Watford site in Vicarage Road as the acute hospital. This plan is not sustainable: it cannot meet the health needs of the people of the area. The estate requires £100m of backlog maintenance and cannot be brought up to modern standards. 

We need a new hospital that everyone can get to, which surveys have repeatedly shown patients want. The present hospital is in a congested corner of our area, next to the ground of a Premier League football club.

attributes.action: Immediate General Election if Article 50 not triggered before April 2017
attributes.background: By April 2017, the British People will have waited 9 months since the Referendum result for Article 50 to be triggered. Not doing so in this time shows disrespect for the British Voters, therefore signatures on this petition have no confidence in the British Government and demand a General Election

attributes.action: Please provide Hampshire Police with funding to find Damien Nettles remains
attributes.background: Damien Nettles aged 16 went missing 20 years ago in Cowes, Isle of Wight. His case remains a missing person despite a presumption of murder. Hampshire Police do not have the resources or funding to elevate this case. His family are desperate for justice and closure to move on. Thank you in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
As the Government provided extra funding for the McCann's & Needham's, we feel Damien's case should have the same level of intervention.

Damien's story was recently featured in an 8 part documentary on BBC3 a Unsolved: The Boy Who Disappeared. Please see the link below for full details:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p041fkdp

attributes.action: Support the establishment of a European Associate Citizenship for UK Citizens
attributes.background:
Charles Goerens, MEP, has tabled an amendment calling for Associate Citizenship of the EU to be offered to citizens of former EU member states. 

This proposal offers a realistic and worthwhile compromise for the 16,141,241 people who voted to remain, at no cost to the UK taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government has a responsibility to the millions of UK Citizens who voted remain. 

This petition calls on the Government to support the establishment of a European Associate Citizenship. Such a move would soften the blow of Brexit for those passionate about the European project, ensure the millions of UK citizens who live and work in the EU can continue the lives they have chosen, and would give future generations the option to live and work in Europe. 

It would cost the UK nothing.

attributes.action: Government to confirm that the June EU referendum was non-binding and advisory.
attributes.background: The government needs to publicly confirm that the referendum was merely advisory. All that is being said is that 'the people have spoken' when well over half of the electorate did not vote to leave. The govt should not assume that those who did not vote at all are not happy with the status quo.

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence to assault an HM Prison Officer.
attributes.background:
A report has revealed that, over a two month period last year, prisoners assaulted more than 1,000 prison officers. This includes 95 of the highest category 'serious' assaults on staff, such as being slashed with homemade weapons.

The two monthly total equates to more than 16 attacks a day.

attributes.action: Suspend all trials of graded exercise therapy in children and adults with ME/CFS
attributes.background: In surveys hundreds of patients have reported harm — some becoming housebound or bedbound, indefinitely — from graded exercise therapy (GET). The Government must demand that research and funding bodies suspend all trials of graded exercise therapy for ME/CFS until the evidence has been reassessed.
attributes.additional_details: Clinical trials such as MAGENTA still use graded exercise therapy, even in children, but are being justified on the basis of the flawed PACE trial. Scientists have severely criticised PACE, the major adult trial that claimed the therapy to be safe and effective. Thousands have demanded retraction of PACE’s “misleading” analyses and 24 ME/CFS charities from 14 countries demanded that its data be released for reanalysis. PACE is no basis for a trial in children or adults. Read more at stopGET.org

attributes.action: Discuss a northern bypass to improve traffic flow at Chichester, West Sussex.
attributes.background: The A27 is a major road connecting the towns and cities of the South Coast. At Chichester the A27 is a dual carriageway to the south which frequently becomes gridlocked. A northern bypass proposal, popular with residents, has been dropped and voting is only on the inferior southern options.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see option details and maps at
www.highways.gov.uk>roads>a27-chichester 
Please take note of the costs, the saving on journey times, environmental impact and the time taken to build the "improvements" with the subsequent traffic congestion. Although the southern options are cheaper than a northern bypass they will all be unable to cope within a few years and the whole process will begin again.
Please help our small voices be heard by joining this petition.
Many thanks for your interest.

attributes.action: Overturn the decision to sell off Preston's historic Fulwood Barracks.
attributes.background: The decision to announce the end of the home of the Duke of Lancaster's regiment as part of the biggest sell-offs of military land any Government has ever announced has been met with shock, surprise and anger by the people of Lancashire.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.lep.co.uk/your-lancashire/preston/fulwood-barracks-to-close-in-shock-mod-move-1-8224299
The Grade II listed building has been home of the Queen's Lancashire Regiment for nearly 150 years and now houses four Infantry battalions. It also houses the popular Lancashire Infantry Museum, the largest Regimental archive in the north of England.
The Barracks is an important part of the history and culture of Preston and it is a vital link between the local regiment and the population.

attributes.action: Make the NHS pay for Bone Marrow Transplant For Adult Sickle Cell Patients
attributes.background: Bone marrow transplant offers a cure for some sickle cells patients, while children have access to this treatment under the NHS, adults do not, even though medical advances have made it a clinically safe procedure with an 85% success rate, in sickle cell adult patients treated in Europe and USA
attributes.additional_details: If the evidence exists internationally that patients could be cured of this disorder with a bone marrow transplant, there is a sense that UK sickle adult patients experience health inequalities around their treatment options and this contradicts NHS values. A successful bone marrow transplant means patients not enduring painful crises or recurrent hospitalisation. This saves the NHS money in the long run, enabling patients to lead healthy productive lives, and not being held hostage by illness

attributes.action: Make Cystic Fibrosis a qualifying condition on the prescription exemption list.
attributes.background: People with Cystic Fibrosis often take 50+ tablets a day just to help them breathe and digest food. It's a life debilitating condition with an average life expectancy of 41, yet Cystic Fibrosis is still not seen serious enough to add it to the medical exemption list. Help us help those with CF!
attributes.additional_details: 11,000 people in the UK have Cystic Fibrosis. It's caused by a faulty gene which affects the movement of salt and water in and out of cells. People with Cystic Fibrosis experience a build-up of thick sticky mucus in the lungs, digestive system and other organs, causing a wide range of challenging symptoms affecting the whole body. It causes chronic infections often requiring weeks of isolated hospital stays, and many people may eventually need lung transplants. https://www.cysticfibrosis.org.uk/

attributes.action: Reinstate the maternity and children's ward at the Alexandra hospital Redditch
attributes.background: My first 2 children was born a the Alexandra hospital Redditch and when my 2 daughters had several seizures the paramedics,consultants and ward staff was exceptional and these services are being stripped away one by one and with the population of Redditch getting bigger it really isn't a good idea
attributes.additional_details: I don't know what I or other families will do when we have to travel so far and we don't have transport to get there but the main concern is the risk to children's lives because of this bad decision to close the maternity,childrens ward does a child have to loose there life for something to be done I hope not

attributes.action: Devolve the power to allow medicinal use of cannabis to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background:
The UK Government controls drugs policy and has no plans to allow the medicinal use of cannabis.

The Scottish Government want to consider reforming laws to allow the medicinal use of cannabis.

This petition calls for the UK Government to give the required power to the Scottish Government.
attributes.additional_details:
Many jurisdictions already allow the medical use of cannabis for conditions such as MS, arthritis and others. A cross party group of MPs has also called for the UK to follow suit.

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/scotland/sturgeon-seeks-right-to-legalise-medical-cannabis-376m6mp7n

http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/14791145.Nicola_Sturgeon_faces_calls_to_back_cannabis_for_medicinal_use_/

https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/sep/13/all-party-group-legalisation-cannabis-medicinal-uses

attributes.action: Make it illegal to not wear a helmet when riding any bike, skateboard or scooter
attributes.background: Georgia Fairthorne fell off a skateboard without a helmet on and is now critical in intensive care. Not wearing a helmet could be a life or death choice. It is already illegal in some countries and should be made illegal in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Help Save Children with Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Children with Neuroblastoma face many months of intense treatment but the chances of relapse are high. There is treatment in the USA that reduces this risk but that has to be funded privately.
The amount of money that is needed to pay for this runs in to hundreds of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of recent cases in the media where families of children with this cancer were trying to raise £550,000 to get this treatment in America. If the treatment is available to reduce the risk we should be providing that treatment here in the UK.

attributes.action: Shift Agricultural Subsidies to Support Environmental Protections post-Brexit.
attributes.background:
The government should redirect subsidies in a post-Brexit domestic agricultural policy, away from environmentally damaging farming, and towards environmental protections. 

Subsidies are needed to support farmers who tackle climate change, mitigate floods, increase biodiversity and soil health.
attributes.additional_details:
The public are understandably discouraged with the current formulation of the Common Agricultural Policy. They don’t want to see their taxes being used to line the pockets of already wealthy landowners, or to prop up failing farming industries unconditionally.

The public wants to see a domestic agricultural policy that is ahead of the curve by leading us on the path towards a low-carbon farming future, where our agricultural system provides significant benefits to the environment.

attributes.action: Ban and make illegal Puppy Farms in the UK
attributes.background: Puppy farms are a money making machine only, the pups and parents are often if not always not cared for properly and end up with behavioural issues and other medical issues.
attributes.additional_details:
Using bitches as breeding machines is disgusting and no reputable breeder would ever do this. There are already many unwanted dogs in the UK, putting a strain on the RSPCA and the many charitable private dog Rescues. There is simply no need for puppy farms at all, they are cruel and should be stopped.

http://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/our-resources/kennel-club-campaigns/puppy-farming/

attributes.action: Abolish the tv licence, it shouldn't be a legal requirement.
attributes.background: I believe the TV licence should be abolished, removed and not a legal requirement. It should be included through your provider for free. Tv is expensive enough without the added extra worry of £130+ A year.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all animal skins and furs to be imported and sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Each year 50 million animals are violently killed for use in the fashion industry. They are beaten, electrocuted and skinned alive for their skins and furs. 

The fur and skin industry is outdated, cruel and unnecessary. It must be consigned to history.
attributes.additional_details:
Cruelty Assured: http://features.peta.org.uk/origin-assured-fur/

9 Shocking Fur facts: http://www.peta.org/features/nine-shocking-fur-facts/

Fur Facts: http://www.bornfreeusa.org/facts.php?p=452&more=1

attributes.action: Stop importing puppies under 6 months of age into the UK.
attributes.background:
Many thousands of puppies are imported at the moment. 
The majority are bred in terrible conditions in puppy farms.
The parents live a life of misery and abuse.
Thousands of dogs are being destroyed every year.
The murder of mans best friend must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It's estimated 40,000 puppies come from Ireland alone each year.
Some puppy farms there have a thousand bitches !Kept in terrible conditions.
Other EU countries would have even worse conditions. 
The UK can stop this cruelty by banning the importing of puppies.
The general public buy puppies from online sellers. They want young baby pups.
These are often dealers,including pet shops, who buy puppies cheaply from abroad, Many of which are sick or even dying.
They often have physiological issues !

attributes.action: Save Remembrance Sunday Parades.
attributes.background: Due to a change in policy roads can no longer be closed. Unless local communities contract a road traffic management company to close the roads at a cost of thousands of pounds. Government should provide the council or police with extra money for these events to take place. Or these events will STOP
attributes.additional_details: local communities are devastated that their local parade or remembrance Sunday service being lost forever. The council do not have the funds for these event to take place. The police can no longer close roads due to a change in policy. Soldier's, have died in 2 world wars and various other conflict since, we need to ensure they are remembered in a fitting manner. These parades need to be saved for future generations so they understand the ultimate sacrifice that was made by these men and woman.

attributes.action: Stop the resale of concert tickets at inflated prices on secondary websites.
attributes.background: Tickets sell out in record time!  then we see them for "resale" within hours on secondary ticket sale websites at ridiculously inflated prices. Reselling of football tickets is illegal under section 166 Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994", why can this law not apply to concert tickets?
attributes.additional_details:
The Which Reports can be found;

http://www.which.co.uk/news/2015/11/which-probes-ticket-resale-rip-off-422307/

and

http://www.which.co.uk/news/2016/05/event-tickets-still-being-sold-unlawfully-443074/
Report in Daily Telegraph relating to the recent sale of Phil Colllins Tickets at The Royal Albert Hall
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/10/21/fan-fury-as-phil-collins-tickets-sell-out-in-15-seconds---only-t/

attributes.action: Re-open Trafford General Hospital as a fully operational Hospital and A&E again.
attributes.background: Trafford General Hospital served south Manchester for decades, a couple of years ago the A&E was closed and since then residents in this region need to go elseware. After a personal experience the A&E at the MRI is overworked and understaffed. Re-open Trafford General as a fully staffed A&E/Hospital
attributes.additional_details: Trafford General is the Birth place of the NHS, I went back to the 'hospital' a few days ago and it's just such a shame, entire wards are closed off and in darkness.  The infestruction, the wards, operating theatres, the buildings etc it's all there going to waste, it could be fully staffed and up and running again in no time at all....  The NHS could certainly do with another hospital in this time of crisis and we have this place just going to waste.

attributes.action: Create a new cabinet post  'Animal Welfare Secretary'
attributes.background: The general public and a growing number of MPs want to see vast improvement in the welfare of domestic, farm and wild animals in the UK and for animals to have a compassionate voice in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Responsibilities could include the desire to 'end long distance live animal exports', 'end caged hens and farrowing crates for pigs', 'introduce better meat labelling', 'have CCTV in all slaughterhouses', 'phase out non stun slaughter', 'have scientific evidence-based debate on badger culling and driven grouse shooting', 'strengthen the ban on hunting with hounds', 'prevent dog fighting and badger baiting and ensure higher prison sentences for perpetrators', 'ban indiscriminate snares' etc.

attributes.action: Provide much needed Truck Stops across the UK with modern facilities.
attributes.background: The Haulage Industry carries valuable cargo. The UK in general needs more dedicated Truck Stops with advanced facilities e.g CCTV, shower blocks, healthy food outlets.Laybys have no facilities and are a last resort. Without HGV's our shops would be empty. Drivers deserve a safe secure resting place.
attributes.additional_details: Already there is inadequate space for HGV's to park up on their rest times.With the volume of vehicles forever increasing on all roads across the UK, this situation will only get worse.Many HGV drivers experience theft of cargo and fuel, even at well known Service Stations.Current services have not grown with the increase of freight on the road, and often have very poor and neglected facilities.Truck drivers are on the road for many days at a time ,they deserve to have decent working facilities.

attributes.action: Stop all refugees to the UK.
attributes.background: This only encourages more to come, we already have enough issues with looking after our own people.  Help should be focused in the closest safe country.

attributes.action: Stop vaccination with the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in our schools.
attributes.background: There is parental concern about the use of the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in schools. There may be a risk of inhalation of the GM viral particles to those not consenting and evidence shows that recently vaccinated children may transmit the vaccine influenza strain to others in their community.
attributes.additional_details: If it is true that non consenting children are exposed to the GM viral particles or to the vaccine strains of influenza in school, the Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Programme would appear to directly contradict the Secretary of State’s declaration in The Health Protection (Vaccination) Regulations 2009. This states that 'there is no provision for imposing or enabling any restriction or requirement which has, or would have, a significant effect on a person’s rights'.

attributes.action: Increase funding for ME/CFS research.
attributes.background: At the moment ME/CFS is diagnosed by ruling out every other illness. Doesn't sound right does it! If you think it's full name Myalgic Encephalomyelitis hard to pronounce, living with it is even harder.

attributes.action: Recognise the state of Palestine now alongside Israel 100 years on from Balfour
attributes.background: Our Government should recognise a state of Palestine now giving practical effect to British Policy of two states, Palestine and Israel, to live side by side in peace and security enabling Palestinians and Israelis to fulfil their right to self-determination, 100 years from the Balfour Declaration
attributes.additional_details: Palestine is recognised by over 130 countries worldwide. The United Kingdom, a permanent member of the UN Security Council,  should now do so as a major contribution to a two state solution to this conflict. While our Government recognised Israel in 1950, it has still not recognised Palestine – despite supporting many United Nations resolutions, and European Council conclusions confirming the Palestinian right to self-determination. This is in our National interest and that of the region
